title: Historical Stock Price Performance of Integer Holdings Corp

content.text: During the 2008 Financial Crisis, Integer Holdings Corp experienced a significant decline in its stock price. From January 2008 to March 2009, the stock price dropped from around $40 per share to approximately $10 per share. This decline was driven by widespread market instability and concerns about the global economy.

Following the recession, Integer Holdings Corp's stock price gradually recovered as market conditions improved. From 2009 to 2013, the stock price consistently increased, reaching a high of over $80 per share in early 2013. This recovery was influenced by improved economic indicators and increased investor confidence.

The COVID-19 pandemic, which triggered global economic uncertainty, had a mixed impact on Integer Holdings Corp's stock price. In the initial phase of the pandemic, from February to March 2020, the stock price experienced a significant drop, falling from around $80 per share to approximately $50 per share. This decline was driven by fears of an economic recession and disrupted supply chains.

As market optimism and vaccine development progressed, Integer Holdings Corp's stock price rebounded during the latter part of 2020 and early 2021. From April 2020 to February 2021, the stock price surged from around $50 per share to over $100 per share. This rally was fueled by positive market sentiment surrounding the recovery prospects and expectations of increased demand for healthcare products.

In 2022, Integer Holdings Corp's stock price experienced increased volatility due to various factors. From February to June 2022, the stock price fluctuated between $90 and $120 per share. This volatility was influenced by market uncertainties, inflation concerns, and changes in investor sentiment. It's important to note that stock prices can be affected by a multitude of factors and can fluctuate on a daily basis.
